wikitext.*:
'''Rosfrith Murray''' ([[1884]]-[[1973]]) was the fourth daughter of Sir [[Wikipedia:James Murray (lexicographer)|James A.H. Murray]], founder of the ''[[Oxford English Dictionary]]''. Murray spent much of her life working for her father on the Dictionary as an assistant. In November [[1918]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] joined the staff as an assistant lexicographer. During this time he met Rosfrith Murray and the two would develop a close friendship.<ref name=TL>{{webcite|author=[[Pieter Collier]]|articleurl=http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/pcollier/DSC00003.htm|articlename=#DSC003 - Smith of Wooton Major - Signed by J.R.R. Tolkien on half title page - with author letter from J.R.R. Tolkien to Rosfrith Murray|dated=|website=TL|accessed=21 May 2012}}</ref>
